page.description: Generates a string containing a Javascript array with data from the specified columns of a JSON object.
page.prototype: C result = json_select(jsonText as C,columns as C [,primaryKey as C [,CRC as L [,flags as C ]]])

item.name: N
item.description: Generate as objects (default behaviour is to output an array).

item.name: S
item.description: Stringize the contents (numeric and boolean values are quoted).

item.name: T
item.description: Trim the key value (remove leading and trailing spaces).

item.name: U
item.description: Enforce uniqueness on selected JSON data.

page.example: dim json as c json = <<%str% [ {"firstname":"John","lastname":"Smith","city":"Boston","state":"MA"}, {"firstname":"Fred","lastname":"Jones","city":"Cambridge","state":"MA"}, {"firstname":"Tom","lastname":"King","city":"New York","state":"NY"} ] %str% result = json_select(json,"firstname,lastname") ? result = [ [ "John" , "Smith" ] , [ "Fred" , "Jones" ] , [ "Tom" , "King" ] ]

section.description: The 'N' option allows for names to be preserved, use JSON_SELECT to limit columns, keep the object format.
